frame.name: Rate_description
frame.definition:
<def-root>The LUs in this frame describe the level that a <fen>Rate</fen>, or the variation in some quantity over a period of time, deviates from the norm. The focal <fen>Event</fen> for which the <fen>Rate</fen> is relevant may be profiled as metonymically referring to the <fen>Rate</fen> of the <fen>Event</fen>. This frame differs from Rate_quantification in that it does not describe the <fen>Rate</fen> with a specific numerical designation.
<ex>The <t>rapid</t> <fex name="Event">increase in obesity</fex> is a major cause of concern.</ex> <ex>Such systems have a <fex name="Degree">very</fex> <t>rapid</t> <fex name="Event">rate</fex> of recovery.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Event
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Event</fen> whose <fen>Rate</fen> is being described.
<ex>He was <t>rapidly</t> <fex name="Event">losing his patience</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Rate
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Rate</fen> at which something happens during an <fen>Event</fen>.
<ex>Anthony marveled at the <t>rapid</t> <fex name="Rate">rate</fex> of production.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>How much the <fen>Rate</fen> deviates from a neutral or expected standard.
<ex>It was followed by an <fex name="Degree">extremely</fex> <t>rapid</t> deterioration of order.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Agent
FE.definition:
<def-root>A participant in an <fen>Event</fen> that is responsible for its unexpected <fen>Rate</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Agent">She</fex> was really <t>fast</t> at shorthand.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: rapid.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: occuring at a higher than expected rate (especially of abstractions)

lexUnit.name: rapidly.adv
lexUnit.definition: FN: at a higher than expected rate

lexUnit.name: fast.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: occuring at a higher than expected rate
